key_insights: The combination of high fever and chills suggests an infectious process, possibly systemic.
The oxygen saturation of 50% is critically low, indicating severe hypoxia that needs urgent assessment and intervention.
Vital signs indicate possible respiratory or systemic instability requiring immediate medical attention.
